caption: Table 4: Ablation study of different hyper-parameters on YCB.
references:
Furthermore, we evaluate the performance of our method with different 𝒯𝒯\mathcal{T} and α𝛼\alpha, where 𝒯𝒯\mathcal{T} is the threshold to filter out easy negative cells before sampling positive ones, and α𝛼\alpha is the weight balancing the Euclidean distance and the minimum barrier distance in Eq. 3.
We use the default settings of 𝒯=0.25𝒯0.25\mathcal{T}=0.25 and α=0.1𝛼0.1\alpha=0.1, and vary only one parameter at a time. As shown in Table 4, the results are stable when 𝒯𝒯\mathcal{T} is set between 0.2 and 0.3, and we use the best value 0.25 found on YCB for all our experiments. Following [18], we use the default value 0.1 for α𝛼\alpha, which is further supported by our results with different α𝛼\alpha values.
